Case reference: 2020010925.CaseDesc: On October 2, 1990, Mabel Wong was seen for the last time, at approximately 10:30pm, as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. It is believed that Mabel left her home to go meet someone. Her vehicle was found approximately two kilometers from her home.

Shoes: Leather, Black, CASUAL, with metal tips

Case reference: 2014006137.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2012, Spencer Joly was last seen in Vernon BC. Spencer told a number of people he was travelling to the Kelowna Airport and eventually flying to Phuket Thailand. Spencer was seen later that same day being dropped off by Taxi in Predator Ridge, a new housing development in Vernon. There was no record of Spencer ever leaving the country or arriving in Thailand.

Case reference: 2014004009.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1987, Dale Eldridge was seen for the last time as he went down to a river with some of his friends in Peace River, Alberta. Prior to that, Dale had attended a party.

Shoes: White, North Star, North Star brand running shoes

Case reference: 2014005569.CaseDesc: Steven O’Brien was last seen on March 20, 1993 in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island. Steven was a first-year student at Holland College’s Culinary Institute in Charlottetown when he went missing after a night out with friends. Steven was last seen walking south on Queen Street around 1:30 am.

Case reference: 2014004406.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1973, Caroline Burns was last seen in the early morning leaving her residence in Molanosa, SK. Molanosa is a small isolated community approximately 70 kilometers south of La Ronge, SK. Extensive searches of the area at the time failed to reveal any trace of Ms. Burns.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing left top molar and left front tooth
Mark: Right Knee, Burn mark on side of either left or right knee

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2014006533.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1983, William Fosseneuve, Raymond Sewap and another person were aboard a boat on the Amisk Lake in Saskatchewan. During the course of their trip to Denare Beach, the trio encountered turbulent waters, which caused William to fall overboard. In an attempt to rescue him, Raymond dove into the water. Both men were last seen submerged in the water.

Case reference: 2014003882.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1991, Marcel Paquette was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec when he left in his car to visit his family in the Gaspésie region. His vehicle was located near the city of Causapscal, Quebec. Marcel is diabetic and may have memory problems.

Tattoo: Right Chest, Devil and "Renee et Marie" in text
Left Chest, Heart and "Diane" in text

Case reference: 2022014122.CaseDesc: On the night of April 5, 2022, Remesie Uy was seen for the last time at her home in Calgary, Alberta.  She is thought to have traveled to the Edmonton, Alberta area. Remesie has not been seen or heard from since.

Pierce: Ears, 2-3 Earrings in one ear.  Unknown which ear.

Case reference: 2022022526.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2022, Jonathan White was last seen in Whistler, British Columbia. He was seen downloading from the gondola on the Blackcomb side and his last known location was the spit near Green Lake in Whistler. He was despondent at that time, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2014003424.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1992, Marie Trahan was last seen in Petit-Shippagan, New Brunswick.  Marie's abandoned vehicle was later located at the wharf.

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2024041945.CaseDesc: Patrick Copelin was seen on March 11, 2011, leaving his residence in Niagara Falls, New York, USA.  Shortly after, he was seen jumping into Niagara Falls at Prospect Point.  At the time of his disappearance, Patrick was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2017013180.CaseDesc: On March 1, 2017, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Maryam Mehrvarz and Kian Norouzian were last seen together in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2011002199.CaseDesc: Sean Tan went missing from his residence, an apartment building on Huron Street in Toronto, on March 7, 2011. Toronto Police Service investigated but to date he has not been located. Mr. Tan  may be despondent and suicidal.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2014004684.CaseDesc: Mr. Claude Gagné disappeared from the sector of Lac des Passes in a forested area near the municipality of La Tuque between September 1st and 2nd, 2000. His boat was found on the shore of the lake with the electric motor at the running position, and his car was found parked at the camp at the same lake. He went to the camp by himself and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005589.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1971, Lillian Giroux was seen for the last time when she was left with relatives in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2012020093.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2003, Garry Guenther, 58 years old, left his residence in the Hepburn district, SK. He was driving his white 1993 Ford F-150 truck with SK licence GGG. Mr. Guenther was reported to have been seen in Hoey, SK on the 23rd/ 24th of April, 2003, however, neither he nor his vehicle have been located.

Sweater: Cotton, Grey, sweat shirt with an image of a fish on the front
Deformity: Right Leg, bow-legged, walks with noticeable limp

Case reference: 2014004990.CaseDesc: On January 6, 1978, at approximately 11:00 p.m., John McNichol was seen for the last time as he left the Crock & Block restaurant located in downtown Kitchener, Ontario. John had met with a friend that evening, and the two had planned to see each other again the next day. The following morning, he failed to show up for work and a note was found stating that he had to leave.

Luggage: SUITCASE, Suitcase, contained Leonard Cohen records
Shirt: Orange, « Grandma Lee » checkered, short sleeve

Case reference: 2014005363.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1986, Edward Beauchamp failed to meet with his probation officer for a scheduled appointment in Edmonton, Alberta. Edward has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, "Born To Be Wild"
Left Forearm, "Born to Raise Hell 1952 Eddie"
Right Hand, "Love" on backs of fingers
Left Hand, Club, diamond, spade and heart on knuckles
Left Hand, "Hate" on backs of fingers
Right Forearm, Cobra and tumbleweed chief
Right Upper Arm, "Born to be free"

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2012020124.CaseDesc: On October 5, 1995, Ronald Couture was seen for the last time at approximately 7:30 a.m. when he left his home in Terrebonne, Quebec. Ronald told his wife he was heading to the south shore area of the city to look for a job. The vehicle he was driving, a white 1993 Pontiac Grand-Am bearing Quebec licence plate WGT 621, was never located. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2023017319.CaseDesc: On April 8th, 2017 Kurt Beehler was last observed in the area of the Rainbow Bridge, Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Kurt was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Cross on inside of forearm

Case reference: 2011000499.CaseDesc: In August 1996, Bruce Berthelot left his family residence in Leamington, Ontario. M. Berthelot indicated that he was going away for a little while and asked his mother for $1000. He had been unemployed for several months and was dealing with some health issues. Prior to leaving he telephoned his friends in Manitoba a number of times. His family believes that he was headed to Western Canada. He has lived in Manitoba in the past. Mr. Berthelot is a skilled carpenter, and enjoys fishing and boating.  He has had no contact with any members of his family or friends since leaving.

Case reference: 2014001414.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1967, Sarah Ovayuak was last seen as she fell into the Tuktoyaktuk Harbour while trying to board a Coast Guard vessel.

Case reference: 2014004162.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1987, Charles Eddy was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Moncton, New Brunswick, where he lived with his brother. Charles suffered from partial schizophrenia, was known to be heavy smoker and carry large sums of money.

Case reference: 2013000136.CaseDesc: Mr. Joseph Moore was last seen on October 31, 2012 by his employer in Kincardine, Ontario.  He was reported missing on November 12, 2012. Upon investigation, Joseph's apartment was found neat and tidy and his clothing and luggage had been left behind. Joseph is known to suffer from severe cases of depression. The last potential sighting was at the Kincardine Davidson Centre on November 8, 2012.  A media blitz was done to request feedback for missing person Joseph Moore with limited feedback. An extensive search of the area was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2012020081.CaseDesc: Emily Osmond (Laplante) lived a reclusive lifestyle on a small acreage on the Northern edge of Kawacatoose First Nation. Emily seldom had contact with her family or friends and the last known contact with them was August 29, 2007. She was last seen on the 9th of September, 2007, by her hired helper. Her disappearance is very unusual. Her vehicle and personal belongings including medication were left at her residence. She also had dogs at her acreage that she cared for that were left unattended. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Emily.

Case reference: 2014003731.CaseDesc: On October 30, 1964 at 1:00 p.m. Murray Hansen left Berens River, Manitoba to go to Black River to deliver some items to a family member. At approximately 3:00 p.m. that day it started to storm and the water on the lake became rough. Mr. Hansen planned to stay in Black River overnight and then return to Berens River. When 5 days passed and he hadn't returned home, his wife began to look for him and discovered that he had never arrived in Black River. On November 3, 1964, Mr. Hansen's boat was found turned over near Bigstone Point and was approximately 100 yards from the shore. Searches were done by air, land and boat but the body of Mr. Hansen was never recovered. Murray Hansen is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2017060723.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2017, Amber Barlow was last seen in the area of 107 Street and 152 Avenue, Edmonton, Alberta.  Amber engages in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014005223.CaseDesc: On March 4th, 2009, Wesley Foulds , 52, left his Abbotsford residence for an appointment in New Westminster.  Mr. Foulds didn't arrive for his appointment, and didn't show up for work later that day.  Mr. Foulds' vehicle was discovered the next day parked near the Hayward Dam in Mission BC.

Case reference: 2006009499.CaseDesc: On February 23, 2003, Fred Takerer was reported missing by his son. Mr. Takerer had physical limits and was not able to get around easily. Police have not been able to locate Mr. Takerer and believe his disappearance to be suspicious.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2014002095.CaseDesc: On May 10, 1980 four men from Grand Forks, North Dakota departed in a boat from the Anama Bay Tourist Camp (Manitoba) for a fishing trip. At approximately 2:45 p.m. on this date an overturned boat was spotted in the Sturgeon Bay area of Lake Winnipeg. The bodies of three of the four men were found. The cause of death for all three of these men was death due to cold exposure (in water) and drowning. The body of William Winters was never recovered. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014000001.CaseDesc: Emma Fillipoff was last seen in the Victoria Inner Harbour area on November 28, 2012.  She was reported to be a shy and quiet person and had been staying at a local shelter for about 6 months prior to her going missing. It is believed that Emma may have been suffering from the onset of some mental health issues. She was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes.  Emma did not use or abuse drugs or alcohol.

Luggage: Canvas, Other, Light coloured canvas bag
Shoes: Blue, Grey, Was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2014002202.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1991, Doctor Jitinkumar Devchand Karamshi Shah, a physician with Sir Thomas Roddick Hospital in Stephenville, Newfoundland, was last seen at 2:45 in the morning. After a night out at a local club, Dr. Shah dropped a friend off at their residence and continued walking home. Dr. Shah was born in Nairobi, Kenya and previously lived and worked in Sheffield, England.

Case reference: 2021032527.CaseDesc: The last time Robert Martin was heard from or seen was in the late 1960s. He was last observed working as a miner in the North West Territories. Police had unsuccessfully performed searches for birth and death data. Robert's current whereabouts are unknown.

Mark: Abdomen, Birthmark, white patch of skin around the belly button
Forehead, Birthmark, white patch of skin, white hair hairline

Case reference: 2014005549.CaseDesc: At the end of September, 2010, Dustin McMillan left Edmonton to drive to Ontario. Police have not been able to confirm where and when Dustin was last seen but he never made it to his final destination.

Case reference: 2013000036.CaseDesc: Pierre Roy was last seen on January 28, 1983.  He was involved in an altercation in a bar in Montreal and has not been seen since.

Teeth: Braces, Wears 2 dentures, the top one is welded
Scar: Right Leg, 2 scars on each side of 5" long

Case reference: 2014001471.CaseDesc: Martin Gant had not been seen by his wife since November 27, 1961, when he destined to Corral, Chile in South America to install machinery in a cannery where he had a contract.

Case reference: 2001002010.CaseDesc: Stephanie Cyr was last seen on June 5, 1998 at her home in Saint-Basile, New Brunswick.

Jacket: Green, orange and yellow plaid jacket
Skirt: Black and white stripped velvet skirt.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2014002649.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1978, Garry Allen and a friend were fishing on Turtle Lake near Glaslyn, SK. Witnesses state the weather changed and the water got very rough. On October 20th, they were reported missing. A swamped canoe and the body of the friend was located, however, searches failed to locate Garry.

Case reference: 2016006093.CaseDesc: On January 19, 2016, Michelle Smits was seen for the last time as she travelled from Cambridge, Ontario to the United States. In February, Michelle’s vehicle was found abandoned in Boston, Massachusetts.

Case reference: 2023067749.CaseDesc: On November 27, 1989, Thomas Nightengale was last seen in the area of the Upper Niagara River in Niagara Falls, New York, USA. Thomas was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005327.CaseDesc: Edward Tandrup was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in February of 1983. Edward Tandrup may have been hitchiking to Vancouver, BC at the time.

Case reference: 2020009588.CaseDesc: On February 8, 1989, at approximately 7:30am, Soekarmia Sarbirja was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Soekarmia was to attend an immigration hearing on February 10, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2014006505.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2014, Sandra Mensah was seen for the last time in the Cartierville district of Montreal, Quebec. Her boyfriend came to pick her up at her home during the evening. Sandra has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020015970.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2017, John Spratt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John is known to be homeless, and has been diagnosed with some serious health issues. John would always check in with his family every couple of years, however, they have not heard from him since 2017.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 1994001800.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 5, 1989, Casey Bohun was seen for the last time by her mother when she was put to bed in her home in Delta, British Columbia. Prior to her disappearance, Casey and her family had recently moved to this area, and she was not familiar with the neighbourhood. Today, Casey may not realize that she was abducted as a child.

Case reference: 2014002549.CaseDesc: Wladyslaw Klisko was last seen on September 11, 1983, in Montreal. He left his house in the morning to go to church. He took the bus but was not seen at the church.

Case reference: 2014005443.CaseDesc: Paolo Renda was last seen on May 20, 2010 in the Montréal-Nord borough of Montreal, Quebec. Paolo's vehicle was later located on Gouin Street in Montreal. Paolo has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015064360.CaseDesc: Josephine Martin was last seen in the early morning hours of November 15, 2015, near Edwards Avenue in The Pas, Manitoba.  Extensive searches were conducted with no success.  Josephine follows a high-risk lifestyle, and her family and friends haven't seen or heard from her since, which is unusual.

Case reference: 2014003539.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2001, Jeffery McArthur was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. It is important to note that Jeffery suffers from a medical condition that affects his coordination, and balance. During the time of his disappearance, he may have been driving a 1993 white Mercury Topaz. The vehicle was subsequently located on September 2, 2001, in the west parking lot of Rundle Park in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2014005676.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2011, Jimmy Larrivée was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Jimmy had indicated that he wanted to spend the day in Rigaud, Quebec. That day, he was seen at a tanning salon on Monk Boulevard in the Ville-Émard District of Montreal. Jimmy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Jewelry: Brown, Necklace with a cross-shaped pendant
Scar: Upper Left Back, Left shoulder blade

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014005278.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2009, Yashpal Mehay left his residence in Surrey BC, and was scheduled to travel to Clinton BC, where he co-owned and operated a Petro Canada Gas Station with family. Yashpal Mehay was last seen at the Costco in Abbotsford BC, at 1450 hours on July 14, 2009, where he purchased tobacco, food and gas. Mr. Mehay failed to arrive at his destination in Clinton BC, and there has been no communication with the family. He was very familiar with this route as he travelled it every other week. The Surrey RCMP has conducted extensive searches along the travelled route with negative results.

Shirt: Green, White, Long sleeve "American Eagle" polo

Case reference: 2014004874.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2006, Tracy Forde was seen for the last time at her home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2014001072.CaseDesc: On July 19 1984, the body of a male believed to be between the ages of 18-29 was found in the waters of the Fraser River near Boston Bar, British Columbia. He had some crowding on his upper teeth and no tattoos or obvious scars. It is believed he was deceased for a few months prior to his remains being recovered.

Case reference: 2014002842.CaseDesc: On August 17, 1971, Stella St. Arnault was seen for the last time as she ran into a treed area in John D’or Prairie Reserve in Alberta. Prior to her disappearance, Stella had had an argument with a family member.

Case reference: 2005001499.CaseDesc: Lois was last seen shortly before midnight at the Village of Lucknow reunion dance on July 3, 1988. She left there and returned to her residence in Kincardine, Ontario where she resided alone. The police investigation indicates Lois was going through her usual evening routine before retiring. Lois, described as a devoted family person and a dedicated worker, failed to report for work on July 4, 1988. Her friends and family became concerned and notified police that she was missing.

Case reference: 2006012999.CaseDesc: Joshua Kennet was last seen in the water after the boat he was riding in overturned on Grayson Lake, Ontario on October 13, 1995. Joshua is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2013000130.CaseDesc: Norman Rivet was last seen on May 24, 1983 at home in Ville-Émard, a neighbourhood of Montreal.  He left a suicide note to his family.

Case reference: 2024015325.CaseDesc: Robert O’Toole was last seen on March 19,2024, in Central Hamilton, Ontario.  Family and colleagues have concerns regarding Robert’s health, noting a significant decline since their last interaction.

Scar: Genitals, Surgical removal of the left testicle
Abdomen, Over the belly button from a feeding tube.

Case reference: 2014004511.CaseDesc: On July 29, 2004 George Davis left a residence near Creston, BC to get cigarettes. He was driving a 1981 brown Chrysler Lebaron with a British Columbia licence plate. The vehicle has not been recovered.

Mark: Eyes, Mole lower lid right eye

Case reference: 2014004211.CaseDesc: On August 24, 1987, Louis Haineault, 48 years old, was last seen heading out in a boat to fish on Cree Lake, north of Buffalo Narrows, SK. Searchers located his boat and fishing nets, however the boat was inoperable. Searches of the area failed to locate Louis.

Case reference: 2014006268.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Brandon Jakobek was seen for the last time flying a plane from Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. Brandon, a Morningstar Air pilot and avid skydiver, had flown in from Toronto to deliver parcels for FedEx. He had informed employees prior to his departure that a warning light had illuminated during his flight and that he needed to run some diagnostic checks. The plane was never found and is thought to be in the Hudson Bay.

Case reference: 2014005905.CaseDesc: Abraham Flett, was last seen around mid-August, 2012 in Thompson, Manitoba. He has not made contact with his family or his employer in Split Lake and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2012000299.CaseDesc: Investigators with York Regional Police Homicide Unit are seeking assistance from the public in their investigation into the disappearance of a 45 year old woman. Cheryl Rowe was last seen by her family on December 22, 2011, just after midnight on Rathfon Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill. The investigation is still ongoing and investigators believe that Ms. Rowe may be the victim of foul play.

Tattoo: Upper Back, children's names, two wings with the words "Shane" and "Christina"

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching

Case reference: 2014005846.CaseDesc: André Boucher was last seen on July 16, 2012 in Montreal. Mr. Boucher was living in a rooming house and left all his belongings behind. Mr. Boucher was also known as "Popeye"

Case reference: 2022018377.CaseDesc: Devon Sinclair Marsman was last seen on February 24, 2022 in Spryfield, Nova Scotia.  Devon's footprints of life ceased on the day he was last seen and he has not been in contact with family or friends since then. Investigators indicate that foul play has not been ruled out.

Case reference: 2021008285.CaseDesc: Trenton Phillips was last seen by a family member at their residence in Red Deer, Alberta in the summer of 2017.  Trenton told the family member he was going to Kenya in Africa with Lifewater to build wells.

Case reference: 2021000139.CaseDesc: On January 1st, 2021, Zachery Lefave was last seen around 12:30 a.m., talking on a cellular phone while walking on Highway # 334 in the Plymouth region of Yarmouth County, Nova Scotia. Zachery had left a New Year’s Eve party that was being held in the area.

Case reference: 2020035043.CaseDesc: On August 17, 2020, Jacques Hébert was seen for the last time when he was preparing to go pick blueberries in the forest near his home in Berry, Quebec. Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Teeth: Upper denture and lower jaw prothesis with implants fixed to metal bar
Pants: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand, work pants
Shirt: Synthetic, Dark Blue, Big Bill brand work shirt
Shoes: Rubber, Black, CROCS style, top cut, camouflage pattern, size 9

Case reference: 2014005390.CaseDesc: On November 10,  2009, Victoria Chan was seen for the last time in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Victoria was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2021050990.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2021, Antony Anuj was last heard from via text message. The origin tower signals of the texts were traced to the Niagara Falls, Ontario area.

Case reference: 2014005517.CaseDesc:
At the time of her disappearance, Amber Guiboche was living in the north end of Winnipeg with her boyfriend and his family. Amber had been leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Amber spent the evening of November 10th, 2010 socializing with friends. Later that evening she went to a friend’s residence on Bushnell St. She left there alone at around 11:45 p.m., and walked to the intersection of Isabel Street and William Ave.  

She was picked up there shortly after by a man driving a burgundy pickup truck. The truck was described as an older, burgundy Chevrolet Silverado, extended cab, short box with a “4x4” decal toward the rear of the box. 

The truck was last seen traveling southbound on Isabel St. It was captured on video in the area in which she was last seen.

Images of this truck and a forensic artist’s sketch of the driver have been made available.

Case reference: 2014002595.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1997, John Grabluk was seen for the last time at the Scarborough Postal Union Office in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, John had taken a leave of absence.

Case reference: 2014001907.CaseDesc: Mary Rose Keadjuk was last seen between late June and August 1990 in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, and was reported missing in September 1990. At the time of her disappearance, Mary Rose was residing at the Gold Range Hotel. In 2003, partial human remains were discovered in Yellowknife, and forensic DNA analysis determined that the remains were those of Mary Rose Keadjuk in 2018. The investigation into her disappearance  is still active and ongoing.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 1 tooth treated and 6 teeth absent.

Case reference: 2007002499.CaseDesc: Aju Chukwudiebere Iroaga, was last seen on May 15, 2006 at 4:30 p.m. by coworkers at Domtar Rd 100, sometimes called Danny Lake Rd, in Bayfield Twp, Lake Rampike. He left his place of employment, which is a local tree planting site, on foot.

Case reference: 2014001743.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1995, Knut Thielemann was last seen walking near the Athabasca Falls in Jasper National Park in Alberta.

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2015049567.CaseDesc: Raymond Chalifoux was last seen on May 25th, 2015 at the Fort St John Hospital. Mr. Chalifoux received abdominal surgery and left the hospital against the advice of medical staff. He left in an unknown direction. Extensive searches were conducted with negative results. Mr. Chalifoux has not been seen or heard from since.

Vest: Black, Black vest with designs on chest

Case reference: 2023064298.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2023, Rebecca Harbowy was last seen after walking away from the Ridge Meadows Hospital on a surveillance camera at 02:05 a.m. walking on the 22800 Block of the Haney Bypass in Ridge Meadows, British Columbia. Rebecca has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Grey, Zip up hoodie with large Nike logo across the chest area
Pants: Black, Sweatpants with PUMA white logo on the lower leg
Shoes: Black, White, Black runners with white rim
Tattoo: Pelvis, Two doves on each side of pelvis/front hip area
Torso (Front), Large writing on each side of upper torso
Front Of Neck, Two roses on each side

Case reference: 2014033444.CaseDesc: On the evening of May 2, 1979, Michel Pelletier, and his older sister, were seen for the last time playing in their relatives’ backyard in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On July 13, 1979, the body of Michel’s sister was found in the St-Lawrence River, however he has not been found.
